bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Charles S. White to Philip Showalter Hench, January 26, 1942

div1.p: White sends Hench more information on Reed and informs him that he has found a yellow fever article, from 1911, to which Reed, Kean, and McCaw contributed.

div1.head: Letter from Charles S. White to Philip Showalter Hench, January 26, 1942
div1.opener:
DR. J. LLOYD COLLINS
OFFICE HOURS
3 TO 5 P. M.
DR. CHARLES S. WHITE
1801 EYE STREET
WASHINGTON, D. C.
January 26, 1942
Dr. Philip Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Philip:
div1.p:
I am enclosing some rambling remarks about
Doctor Reed. Doctor Borden has been contacted and
has promised to send direct some information which
may fill a few gaps.

A few days ago I picked up in our medical school
library, in verifying Reed's connection with the
college, a volume entitled, YELLOW FEVER -
It was published by the Washington Government Printing
Office 1911, as the result of a resolution offered
in the Senate February 17, 1911 -
McCaw, Kean, Reed contributed to it. I shall be
glad to send it on, if you wish.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, Chas. S. White CSW-emf
